edge: Child of Chucky and Tiffany, being held captive by 'Psychs' until he escapes and resurrects the Chucky and Tiffany dolls with a voodoo amulet

invites Redman to her home for a role as the Virgin Mary in his feature-film directorial debut
knocks Jennifer and Joan out and uses a turkey baster to inseminate Jennifer with Chucky's semen, intending to use her baby as a host for Glen/Glenda's soul

accidentally causes Peters to fall and be soaked in sulfuric acid, killing him

Jennifer believes Redman is responsible for her pregnancy, but Redman explains he had a vasectomy. Redman fires Jennifer from his film due to her pregnancy, as he thinks pregnant women are not attractive enough for his vision.
Jennifer wakes up believing she is pregnant, but Tiffany guts Redman in anger over his misogyny, which Jennifer witnesses.
Redman's dismissal of pregnant women as not attractive enough for his vision is a consequence of his misogynistic beliefs.
Glen, one soul in the body of Glen/Glenda, is a pacifist.
The other soul in the body of Glen/Glenda, Glenda, is a psychopath.
Jennifer's full pregnant belly is a consequence of the voodoo magic she experiences.
Chucky accepts his life as a living doll and no longer wishes to become human, disgusted by this realization.
Tiffany decides to leave Chucky due to his violent behavior.
Stan sacrifices himself to save Jennifer from harm.
Jennifer is rushed to the hospital.
Tiffany drugs Jennifer and begins to possess her,
but Chucky breaks in and kills Tiffany with an axe.
Devastated, Glen snaps and attacks Chucky,
striking him with the axe.
but Glen reveals it is actually him and not his murderous twin.
who praises Glen for his actions before being decapitated.

during a birthday party for the twins, a nanny quits because Glenda scares her.
